alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Laurel, Bell, Knox, Whitley and Clay Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hightop to Packard. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... London, London-Corbin Airport, Levi Jackson S.P., Fariston, Sublimity City, McHargue and Lynn Camp around 250 PM EDT. Lesbas, Birdseye, Maplesville, Chenoa, Bryants Store, King, Clate, Tuttle and Swan Lake around 255 PM EDT. Wheeler, Kayjay, Deer Lick, Ingram, Marydell, Portersburg, Lida, Davisburg, Langnau and Lake around 300 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Urban, Byron, Hooker, Clear Creek Springs, Grace, Trosper, Bush, Pigeonroost, Flat Lick, Fogertown, Pineville, Wallsend, Sidell, Wasioto, Straight Creek, Fourmile, Herron, Fall Rock, East Pineville, Horse Creek Junction, Manchester, Arjay, Bernice, Cary, Blanche, Kettle Island, Tanksley, Mill Pond, Littleton and Rella. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
